description: discharging efficiency used in Condor
technologies considered in Condor

resolution of the dispatch algorithm in Condor (default: 50)- determines the number of discrete values that marginal storage's energy capacity is broken up into for the dynamic program. Higher=slower and more accurate. Don't set below 20

condor resolution method (equal, scaled) (default: equal) - equal: each storage tech uses condor_res (default: 50); scaled: battery_2 uses condor_res (default 15), remaining storage techs have increasing Condor resolution scaled by their duration.
storage power capacity used in Condor to calculate storage energy value
choosing techs to calculate storage value for (options: interp, all) (default: interp)
default mingen level for hydro techs for the curtailment script
default max generator size for mingen calculations
step size for mingen adjustment to curtailment calculations
step size (in MW) of additional transmission's ability to reduce curtailment
number of decimals to round results to for ReEDS
log option for GAMS files
default max number of cycles per day for existing storage to recover curtailment
values smaller than this are set to 0 for results that are sent back to ReEDS
data year to use in Osprey and ReEDS for hourly data
generators smaller than this size (in MW) are dropped from Osprey
storage devices less than this size (in MW) are dropped from Osprey
length of time-series used in Osprey
number of top hours considered in annual cc calculations
when true: annual cc values are calculated
when true: seasonal cc values are calculated
default value for CSP cc when not explicitly considering the cc of CSP
step size (in MW) used for calculating CSP CC when the switch is on
default efficiency value to use for assessing peaking storage potential
step size used for marginal CSP cc calculations
max fraction of peak load considered for storage peaking capacity assessment
default value (in MW) for the safety bin size in ReEDS
additional duration (in minutes) that is required of storage to receive full capacity credit
step size (in MW) used when determining the peaking capacity potential of storage
number of top hours considered in seasonal cc calculations
when true: delete Augur CSV files after it finishes
sleep time for skipping Augur steps - helps if watching command window when debugging
